member.name: M:OctreeZone.TerrainZoneRenderable.UpdateCustomGpuParameter(Axiom.Graphics.GpuProgramParameters.AutoConstantEntry,Axiom.Graphics.GpuProgramParameters)
member.summary: Update a custom GpuProgramParameters constant which is derived from information only this Renderable knows.
member.remarks: This method allows a Renderable to map in a custom GPU program parameter based on it's own data. This is represented by a GPU auto parameter of AutoConstantType.Custom, and to allow there to be more than one of these per Renderable, the 'data' field on the auto parameter will identify which parameter is being updated. The implementation of this method must identify the parameter being updated, and call a 'SetConstant' method on the passed in object, using the details provided in the incoming auto constant setting to identify the index at which to set the parameter.
member.param: The auto constant entry referring to the parameter being updated.
The parameters object which this method should call to set the updated parameters.

member.name: M:OctreeZone.TerrainZoneRenderable.GetWorldTransforms(Axiom.Math.Matrix4[])
member.summary: Gets the world transform matrix / matrices for this renderable object.
member.remarks:
If the object has any derived transforms, these are expected to be up to date as long as all the SceneNode structures have been updated before this is called.
This method will populate xform with 1 matrix if it does not use vertex blending. If it does use vertex blending it will fill the passed in pointer with an array of matrices, the length being the value returned from getNumWorldTransforms.

member.name: M:OctreeZone.TerrainZoneRenderable.GetSquaredViewDepth(Axiom.Core.Camera)
member.summary: Returns the camera-relative squared depth of this renderable.
member.remarks: Used to sort transparent objects. Squared depth is used rather than actual depth to avoid having to perform a square root on the result.

members.member: Bounding box of this tile

member.name: P:OctreeZone.TerrainZoneRenderable.BoundingRadius
member.summary: An abstract method required by subclasses to return the bounding box of this object in local coordinates.

member.name: P:OctreeZone.TerrainZoneRenderable.Lights
member.summary: Gets a list of lights, ordered relative to how close they are to this renderable.
member.remarks: Directional lights, which have no position, will always be first on this list.

member.name: P:OctreeZone.TerrainZoneRenderable.NormalizeNormals
member.summary: Returns whether or not this Renderable wishes the hardware to normalize normals.

member.name: P:OctreeZone.TerrainZoneRenderable.NumWorldTransforms
member.summary: Gets the number of world transformations that will be used for this object.
member.remarks: When a renderable uses vertex blending, it uses multiple world matrices instead of a single one. Each vertex sent to the pipeline can reference one or more matrices in this list with given weights. If a renderable does not use vertex blending this method returns 1, which is the default for simplicity.

member.name: P:OctreeZone.TerrainZoneRenderable.UseIdentityProjection
member.summary: Returns whether or not to use an 'identity' projection.
member.remarks: Usually IRenderable objects will use a projection matrix as determined by the active camera. However, if they want they can cancel this out and use an identity projection, which effectively projects in 2D using a {-1, 1} view space. Useful for overlay rendering. Normal renderables need not override this.

member.name: P:OctreeZone.TerrainZoneRenderable.UseIdentityView
member.summary: Returns whether or not to use an 'identity' projection.
member.remarks: Usually IRenderable objects will use a view matrix as determined by the active camera. However, if they want they can cancel this out and use an identity matrix, which means all geometry is assumed to be relative to camera space already. Useful for overlay rendering. Normal renderables need not override this.

member.name: P:OctreeZone.TerrainZoneRenderable.PolygonModeOverrideable
member.summary: Gets whether this renderable's chosen detail level can be overridden (downgraded) by the camera setting. override true means that a lower camera detail will override this renderables detail level, false means it won't.

3D array of children of this octree. @remarks Children are dynamically created as needed when nodes are inserted in the Octree. If, later, the all the nodes are removed from the child, it is still kept arround.

member.name: M:OctreeZone.Octree.IsTwiceSize(Axiom.Math.AxisAlignedBox)
member.summary: Determines if this octree is twice as big as the given box. @remarks This method is used by the OctreeSceneManager to determine if the given box will fit into a child of this octree.

member.name: M:OctreeZone.Octree.GetChildIndexes(Axiom.Math.AxisAlignedBox,System.Int32@,System.Int32@,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Returns the appropriate indexes for the child of this octree into which the box will fit. @remarks This is used by the OCtreeSceneManager to determine which child to traverse next when finding the appropriate octree to insert the box. Since it is a loose octree, only the center of the box is checked to determine the octant.

members.member: Checks how the axis aligned box intersects with the plane bounded volume
Checks how the second box intersects with the first.
Checks how the box intersects with the sphere.
It's assumed the the given box has already been proven to fit into a child. Since it's a loose octree, only the centers need to be compared to find the appropriate node.

member.name: P:OctreeZone.Octree.CullBounds
member.summary: Creates the AxisAlignedBox used for culling this octree.
member.remarks: Since it's a loose octree, the culling bounds can be different than the actual bounds of the octree.
